Article.ArticleTitle: Effects of Language Skills and Strategy Use on Vocabulary Learning Through Lexical Translation and Inferencing.

Abstract.AbstractText: This study explores how vocabulary learning strategy usage and skills in the four language domains relate to participants' increase in vocabulary size and to the learning of specific vocabulary items over a certain period of time. Sixty-one advanced L1 Arabic L2 learners of English read target words in semi-authentic reading materials and were instructed to either guess the meaning from context or consult a dictionary. Pre- and delayed post-tests assessed vocabulary size and knowledge of the target vocabulary items. Results showed that learning through inferencing, but not learning through dictionary use, depended on learners' familiarity with the particular learning strategy. Additionally, note taking and reading comprehension influenced lexical knowledge and acquisition in complex ways.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: School of Languages, Literatures and Linguistics, Bangor University, Bangor, Gwynedd, LL57 2DG, UK.
Department of English Studies, University of Graz, Graz, Austria. anouschka.foltz@uni-graz.at.
